term.name: panentheism
term.source: From Greek pan: all, Greek: in, and Greek theos: god.
term.def: The doctrine that everything is in God or that everything is a mode or attribute of God. This idea is subtly different from &pantheism;, since it doesn't assert that God and Nature are identical. Panentheism is often associated with exponents of &rationalism; such as Leibniz (1646-1716) and especially Spinoza (1632-1677).
